Package com.diy.hardware.external

Class CardIssuer

java.lang.Object
com.diy.hardware.external.CardIssuer
public class CardIssuer extends Object
Represents external companies that issue cards and authorize payments made with them.

This class uses a transactional model that is simpler than the real thing: to debit a purchase, a hold is first placed on the amount and then the transaction is posted. It does not quite work like that in the real world.

  • Constructor Details

    • CardIssuer

      public CardIssuer(String name, long maximumHoldCount)
      Create a card provider.
      Parameters:
      name - The company's name.
      maximumHoldCount - The maximum number of holds permitted on cards issued by this issuer.
      Throws:
      SimulationException - If name is null.

  • Method Details

    • block

      public boolean block(String cardNumber)
      Blocks the card corresponding to the indicated number, thereby preventing new transactions.
      Parameters:
      cardNumber - The number of the card to block.
      Returns:
      true, if the card has been successfully blocked; otherwise, false.

    • unblock

      public boolean unblock(String cardNumber)
      Eliminates the block on the card corresponding to the indicated number, thereby permitting new transactions.
      Parameters:
      cardNumber - The number of the card to unblock.
      Returns:
      true, if the card has been successfully unblocked; otherwise, false.

    • addCardData

      public void addCardData(String number, String cardholder, Calendar expiry, String ccv, double amount)
      Adds information about a card to the company's database. They do this when they create the card.
      Parameters:
      number - The card number.
      cardholder - The name of the cardholder.
      expiry - The expiry date of the card. Must be in the future.
      ccv - The security code on the back of the card.
      amount - For a credit card, this represents the credit limit. For a debit card, this is how much money is available. (Yes, it is a simplistic simulation.)

    • authorizeHold

      public long authorizeHold(String cardNumber, double amount)
      Authorizes a hold on the indicated amount for the card with the indicated number. If successful, the hold is kept indefinitely until either released explicitly or the transaction is completed.
      Parameters:
      cardNumber - The number of the card on which to place a hold.
      amount - The amount to hold.
      Returns:
      -1 if the hold failed; otherwise, a non-negative integer representing a code to reference the hold.

    • releaseHold

      public boolean releaseHold(String cardNumber, long holdNumber)
      Eliminates the hold corresponding to the indicated hold number, on the card corresponding to the indicated card number.
      Parameters:
      cardNumber - The card on which to release the hold.
      holdNumber - The identifier of the hold to be released.
      Returns:
      true, if the hold has been successfully released; otherwise, false.

    • postTransaction

      public boolean postTransaction(String cardNumber, long holdNumber, double actualAmount)
      Records a transaction against the card corresponding to the indicated card number. A hold must have been successfully placed on the card prior to this transaction, corresponding to the indicated hold number.

      The actual amount should be less than or equal to the amount in the corresponding hold. Otherwise, this transaction will fail.

      Parameters:
      cardNumber - The number of the card on which the transaction is to be posted.
      holdNumber - The number of the initial hold placed on the card.
      actualAmount - The amount to be charged against the card.
      Returns:
      true, if the posting was successful; otherwise, false.
